data_table.description: ECG Serial Change, CEBD Form (CHD Cohort Surveillance). Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: CONTYR
variable.description: Contact year - Surv. Record Seq. Number [1]

variable.name: CEBD63
variable.description: Type Of Suppression (6xx) - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD71
variable.description: Third Or Last - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBDFLAG
variable.value: Presence

variable.name: CEBD05
variable.description: Q-QS Pattern (1xx) I aVL V6 - 1st ECG
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead a VL
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec lead I or V6
QS pattern in lead I. Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1
Initial R amplitude decreasing to 2 mm or less in every beat (and absence of codes 3-2, 7-1-1, 7-2-1, or 7-3 between V5 and V6. (All beats in lead V5 must have an initial R > 2 mm.)
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3, plus Q duration equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead aVL

variable.name: CEBD06
variable.description: Q-QS Pattern (1xx) II III aVF - 1st ECG

variable.name: CEBD07
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3 plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in any of leads V2-V5
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec in any of leads V1-V5
QS pattern when initial R-wave is present in adj lead to the right on the chest, in any leads V2-V6
QS pattern in all of leads V1-V4 or V1-V5
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec, in any of leads V2-V5
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in any of leads V2-V5
QS pattern in all of leads V1-V3 (do not code in the presence of 7-1-1

Initial R amplitude decreasing to 2.0mm or less in every beat (and absence of codes 3-2, 7-1-1, 7-2-1, or 7-3) between any of leads V2 and V3, V3 and V4, or V4 and V5 (all beats in the lead immediately to the right on the chest must have an initial R > 2
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3 plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 and < 0.03 sec in any of leads V2-V5
QS pattern in lead V1 and V2. (Do not code in the presence of 3-1 or 7-1-1.)

variable.name: CEBD08
variable.description: ST Segment Depression (4xx) I aVL V6 - 1st ECG
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm and ST segment upward sloping or U-shaped, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm, and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6

variable.name: CEBD09
variable.description: ST Segment Depression (4xx) II III aVF - 1st ECG
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in lead II
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm and ST segment upward sloping, or U-shaped, in lead II
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in lead II

variable.name: CEBD10
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1 - V5
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in any of leads V2 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm and ST segment upward sloping or U-shaped in any of leads V1 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1-V5
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1 - V5

variable.name: CEBD11
variable.description: T Wave (5x) I aVL V6 - 1st ECG
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in either of leads I, V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm

T amplitude negative or diphasic (positive-negative or negative-positive type) with negative phase at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm

variable.name: CEBD12
variable.description: T Wave (5x) II III aVF - 1st ECG
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude negative or diphasic with negative phase (negative-positive or positive-negative type) at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead II; not Coded in lead aVF

variable.name: CEBD13
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in any of leads V2 - V5
T amplitude negative (flat), or diphasic (negative-positive or positive-negative type) with negative phase at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm, in any of leads V2 - V5
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase, in any of leads V3 - V5
T amplitude positive and T/R amplitude ratio < 1/20 in any of leads V3, V4, V5; R wave amplitude must bemore or equal to 10.0 mm

variable.name: CEBD14
variable.description: ST Segment elevation (92x) I aVL V6 - 1st ECG
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in any of leads I, aVL, V6

variable.name: CEBD15
variable.description: ST Segment elevation (92x) II III aVF - 1st ECG

variable.name: CEBD16
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in lead V5 or ST segment elevation more or equal to 2.0 mm in any of leads V1 - V4

variable.name: CEBD17
variable.value: (All criteria measured only on second to last complete normal beat.)
(Measured only on second to last complete normal beat.)

variable.name: CEBD18
variable.value: Complete (third degree) A-V block (permanent or intermittent) in any lead. Atrial and ventricular complexes independent, and atrial rate faster than ventricular rate, with ventricular rate < 60
P-R (P-Q) interval more or equal to 0.22 sec in the majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
Short P-R interval. P-R interval < 0.12 sec in all beats of any two of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
Artificial pacemaker
Artificial pacemaker
Mobitz Type II (occurrence of P-wave on time with dropped QRS and T)
Partial (seCondition degree) A-V block in any lead (2:1 or 3:1 block)
Wenckebach's Phenomenon (P-R interval increasing from beat to beat until QRS and T dropped)

Wolff-Parkinson-White Pattern (WPW), persistent. Sinus P-wave. P-R interval < 0.12 sec, plus QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec, plus R peak duration more or equal to 0.06 sec, coexisting in the same beat and present in the majority of beats in any of leads I, II, aVL, V4 - V6 (6

variable.name: CEBD19
variable.value: Incomplete right bundle branch block. QRS duration < 0.12 sec in each of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, and R' > R in either of leads V1, V2 (Code as 3-2 in addition if those criteria are met. 7-3 suppresses code 1-2-8.)
Intraventricular block. QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF (7-4 suppresses all 2, 3, 4, 5, 9-2, 9-4, 9-5 codes.)
R-R' pattern in either of leads V1, V2 with R' amplitude more or equal to R

Incomplete left bundle branch block. (Do not code in the presence of any codable Q- or QS-wave.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.10 sec and < 0.12 in the majority of beats of each of leads I, aVL, and V5 or V6

Complete left bundle branch block (LBBB) (Do not code in presence of 6-1, 6-4-1, 6-8, 8-2-1 or 8-2-2.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, plus R peak duration more or equal to 0.06 sec in a majority of beats (of the same

Complete right bundle branch block (RBBB). (Do not code in the presence of 6-1, 6-4-1, 6-8, 8-2-1 or 8-2-2.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, plus: R' > R in V1 or V2; or QRS mainly upright, with R peak
Intermittent right bundle branch block. Same as 7-2-1 but with presence of normally conducted QRS complexes of different shape than RBBB pattern

variable.name: CEBD20
variable.value: Low QRS amplitude. QRS peak-to-peak amplitude < 5 mm in all beats in each of leads I, II, III, or < 10 mm in all beats in each of leads V1 - V6

variable.name: CEBD21
variable.value: P-wave amplitude more or equal to 2.5 mm in any of leads II, III, aVF, in a majority of beats. 9-4-1 QRS transition zone at V3 or to the right of V3 on the chest. (Do not code in the presence of 6-4-1, 7-1-1, 7-2-1 or 7-4.)

variable.name: CEBD22
variable.value: T-wave amplitude > 12 mm in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, V1 - V6 (Do not code in the presence of 6-4-1, 7-1-1, 7-2-1 or 7-4.)

variable.name: CEBD25
variable.value: Technical problems which interfere with coding
Technical problems which do not interfere with coding

variable.name: CEBD30
variable.description: Major Q I aVL V6 - 1st ECG

variable.name: CEBD31
variable.description: Minor Q I aVL V6 - 1st ECG

variable.name: CEBD32
variable.description: Major Q II III aVF - 1st ECG

variable.name: CEBD33
variable.description: Minor Q II III aVF - 1st ECG

variable.name: CEBD40
variable.description: Q-QS Pattern (1xx) I aVL V6 - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead a VL
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec lead I or V6
QS pattern in lead I. Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1
Initial R amplitude decreasing to 2 mm or less every beat (and absence of codes 3-2, 7-1-1, 7-2-1, or 7-3 between V5 and V6 (all beats in lead V5 must have an initital R > 2mm)
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead aVL lead I or V6

variable.name: CEBD41
variable.description: Q-QS Pattern (1xx) II III aVF - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD42
variable.description: Q-QS Pattern (1xx) V1-V5 - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3 plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in any of leads V2-V5
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec in any of leads V1-V5
QS pattern when initial R-wave is present in adj lead to the right on the chest, in any leads V2-V6
QS pattern in all of leads V1-V4 or V1-V5
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec, in any of leads V2-V5
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in any of leads V2-V5
QS pattern in all of leads V1-V3 (do not code in the presence of 7-1-1

Initial R amplitude decreasing to 2.0 mm or less in every beat (and absence of codes 3-2, 7-1-1, 7-2-1, or 7-3) between any of leads V2 and V3, V3 and V4, or V4 and V5 (all beats in the lead immediately to the right on the chest must have an initial R > 2 mm
Q/R amplitude ration=1/5 and < 1/3 plus Q duration =0.02 and <0.03 sec in any of leads v2-v5
QS pattern in lead v1 and v2 (do not code in the presence of 3-1 or 7-1-1)

variable.name: CEBD43
variable.description: ST Segment Depression (4xx) I aVL V6 - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm and ST segment upward sloping or U-shaped, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm, and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6

variable.name: CEBD44
variable.description: ST Segment Depression (4xx) II III aVF - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in lead II
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm and ST segment upward sloping, or U-shaped, in lead II
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF

variable.name: CEBD45
variable.description: ST Segment Depression (4xx) V1-V5 - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1 - V5
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in any of leads V2 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm and ST segment upward sloping or U-shaped in any of leads V1 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1-V5
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1 - V5

variable.name: CEBD46
variable.description: T Wave (5x) I aVL V6 - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in either of leads I, V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm

T amplitude negative or diphasic (positive-negative or negative-positive type) with negative phase at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm

variable.name: CEBD47
variable.description: T Wave (5x) II III aVF - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude negative or diphasic with negative phase (negative-positive or positive-negative type) at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead II; not Coded in lead aVF

variable.name: CEBD48
variable.description: T Wave (5x) V1-V5 - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude negative or diphasic with negative phase (negative-positive or positive-negative type) at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead II; not Coded in lead aVF
T amplitude positive and T/R amplitude ratio, 1/20 in any of leads v3, v4, v5; R wave amplitude must be = 10.0 mm

variable.name: CEBD49
variable.description: ST Segment elevation (92x) I aVL V6 - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in any of leads I, aVL, V6

variable.name: CEBD50
variable.description: ST Segment elevation (92x) II III aVF - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in any of leads II, III, aVF

variable.name: CEBD51
variable.description: ST Segment elevation (92x) V1-V5 - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in lead V5 or ST segment elevation more or equal to 2.0 mm in any of leads V1 - V4

variable.name: CEBD52
variable.value: Left: R amplitude > 26 mm in either V5 or V6, or R amplitude > 20.0 mm in any of leads I, II, III, aVF, or R

Right: R amplitude more or equal to 5.0 mm and R amplitude more or equal to S amplitude in the majority of beats in lead V1, when S amplitude is > R amplitude somewhere to the left on the chest of V1 (codes 7-3 and 3-2, if criteria for both are present)
(Measured only on second to last complete normal beat.)

variable.name: CEBD53
variable.description: A-V Conduction Defect (6xx) - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: Complete (third degree) A-V block (permanent or intermittent) in any lead. Atrial and ventricular complexes independent, and atrial rate faster than ventricular rate, with ventricular rate < 60
P-R (P-Q) interval more or equal to 0.22 sec in the majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
Short P-R interval. P-R interval < 0.12 sec in all beats of any two of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
Artificial pacemaker
Partial (second degree) A-V block in any lead (2:1 or 3:1 block)
Wenckebach's Phenomenon (P-R interval increasing from beat to beat until QRS and T dropped)
Value='42' WPW Pattern, intermittent. WPW pattern in < 50% of beats in appropriate leads

variable.name: CEBD54
variable.description: Ventricular Conduction Defect (7xx) - Follow Up ECG
variable.value: Incomplete right bundle branch block. QRS duration < 0.12 sec in each of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, and R' > R in either of leads V1, V2 (Code as 3-2 in addition if those criteria are met. 7-3 suppresses code 1-2-8.)
(7-4 suppresses all 2, 3, 4, 5, 9-2, 9-4, 9-5 codes.)
QRS duration more or equal to 0.10 sec and < 0.12 in the majority of beats of each of leads I, aVL, and V5 or V6 (Do not code in the presence of any codable Q- or QS-wave.)

variable.name: CEBD55
variable.value: Low QRS amplitude. QRS peak-to-peak amplitude < 5 mm in all beats in each of leads I, II, III, or < 10 mm in all beats in each of leads V1 - V6

variable.name: CEBD56
variable.value: P-wave amplitude more or equal to 2.5 mm in any of leads II, III, aVF, in a majority of beats. 9-4-1 QRS transition zone at V3 or to the right of V3 on the chest (Do not code in the presence of 6-4-1, 7-1-1, 7-2-1 or 7-4.)

variable.name: CEBD57
variable.value: T-wave amplitude > 12 mm in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, V1 - V6 (Do not code in the presence of 6-4-1, 7-1-1, 7-2-1 or 7-4.)

variable.name: CEBD60
variable.value: Technical problems which interfere with coding
Technical problems which do not interfere with coding

variable.name: CEBD64
variable.description: Bundle Branch Block - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD65
variable.description: Major Q I AVL V6 - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD66
variable.description: Minor Q I AVL V6 - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD67
variable.description: Major Q II III AVF - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD68
variable.description: Minor Q II III AVF - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD69
variable.description: Major Q V1-V5 - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD70
variable.description: Minor Q V1-V5 - Follow Up ECG

variable.name: CEBD142
variable.description: Heart Rate Follow-up ECG-Beats Per Minute
